comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The Rigging Shed (1887) on Garden Island (see note) should help date this photo. The Marine Barracks (1888) are not complete, but have gained another floor by the time Henry King took this photo a few metres to the left (and the paint job was complete) - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2363491416/

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Can your eagle eyes pick up anything else on this not so clear pic of Garden Island? - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2363484098/ ; Got any thoughts about the date?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Ha! - I am still on limited internet so cannot study it too much at present.  I remember having great trouble finding the dates of those buildings via a Garden Island website which I have lost.   I think it must be c.1888,  because of the unfinished Marine Barracks.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Per this item in the T&CJ of 8/1/1887, the tender for the erection of the barracks had recetly been accepted...the contract appears to have required that the building be completed within 15 months (9th notice, column 2) - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71679914

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Here's how things looked in 1877...almost idyllic - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=420989
